comments: Terms start and end with the digit 5 since all terms are divisible by 5, i.e., the corresponding values of n are odd (see A027579). - _Chai Wah Wu_, Jan 18 2016
links: P. De Geest, Palindromic Sums of Squares of Consecutive Integers
mathematica: Select[Table[n^2 + (n + 1)^2 + (n + 2)^2 + (n + 3)^2 + (n + 4)^2, {n, 10^7}], # == Reverse@ # &@ IntegerDigits@ # &] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jan 24 2016 *)
prog: (Python)A027580_list = []for i in range(1,10**8,2):    s = str(5*(i*(i+4)+6))    if s == s[::-1]:        A027580_list.append(int(s)) # _Chai Wah Wu_, Jan 18 2016
author: _Patrick De Geest_
